intro: Vincetoxicum sibiricum var. gracilentum, commonly known as Siberian milkvetch, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-bearing fruits. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and trifoliate leaves. It produces small, yellowish flowers in clusters, which are followed by elongated, hairy pods containing seeds. This species is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to harsh, alpine environments.
